article.headline: CS Northridge 74, UC Riverside 56
article.story: RIVERSIDE, Calif. (AP) -- Jonathan Heard scored 20 points off the bench and Cal State Northridge snapped a three-game losing streak with a 74-56 victory Thursday over UC Riverside. Heard played just 28 minutes but made the most of his time, going 2-for-4 from 3-point range and 6-for-8 from the free-throw line. Bakari Altheimer scored 12 points, and Rob Haynes added 10 for Cal State Northridge (9-11, 3-6 Big West Conference). Mike Efevberha, who entered Thursday tied for the conference lead with 18.2 points per game, had an off night for Northridge, scoring just nine points. Steve Williams, Dedrick Bates and Larry Cunningham each had 10 points for UC Riverside (3-17, 3-6). Bates, who had averaged 18 points in the Highlanders' last five games, went down with a left knee injury early in the second half and did not return. Northridge opened the game with a 10-2 run and led 32-27 at halftime. The Matadors extended their lead to 12, 40-28, on a Haynes 3-pointer from the left wing with 16:39 to play. Riverside turned the ball over 24 times and shot 0-for-5 on 3-point attempts. The Highlanders hadnt been shut out from behind the arc in 306 games dating back to 1994.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
